page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: For a thousand years or more the people of the{Grosmont}area have been involved in farming.On the grassy hill sides sheep predominate but the more fertile,flatter river valley is most suitable for cattle rearing and crops. This pattern of agriculture was formed quite early,because we know that in the thirteenth century,the{King}of {England}was making profits from the sale of wheat,barley and oats as well as fleeces,while the{Abbot}of{Dore {Abbey}was raising sheep on the hills, the wool from which probably supplied the local cloth industry.Today,the cloth industry has gone but the local farmers still raise sheep and cattle and grow cereals but the profits no longer go to the{Crown}or the{Church and the methods they use are more up to date.
